seo.title: AI Document Processing for Disability Benefits Cases — Dodonai
seo.description: Dodonai helps disability benefits attorneys organize medical records into chronologies and summaries. Process SSDI, LTD, and VA disability claims faster with AI-powered document review.

hero.headline: AI Document Processing for Disability Benefits Attorneys
hero.subheadline: Disability claims hinge on medical documentation. Dodonai turns thousands of pages into organized chronologies and summaries in minutes — so your team builds stronger SSDI, LTD, and VA claims faster.

sections.heading: How Disability Benefits Firms Use AI Document Processing
paragraphs: The SSA's five-step sequential evaluation decides every SSDI claim, and it comes down to one question: do the medical records support an RFC restrictive enough to preclude work, or does the impairment meet a Blue Book listing? LTD carriers run their own medical review. VA claims require service-connection evidence. In every case, how well you organize and present the medical record determines the outcome.

That record organization is where most disability practices spend the bulk of their time. A single SSDI case can involve thousands of pages from primary care physicians, specialists, hospitals, and mental health providers — records spanning years that need to be organized into a coherent timeline before the ALJ hearing. When the vocational expert testifies about jobs in the national economy, you need the medical evidence backing every functional limitation in the RFC.

Dodonai compresses that disability benefits medical record review from days into minutes. Upload a claimant's records and receive a complete {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|medical chronology}} organized by date, provider, diagnosis, and treatment. Every data point traces to the exact source page so your team can verify against the original records before submitting to the SSA, an insurance carrier, or the VA — and quickly pull the treatment notes documenting functional limitations that drive the RFC. Building an SSDI medical chronology no longer has to be the bottleneck.

Dodonai meets the security standards disability claims require — HIPAA compliant with signed BAAs, SOC 2 Type II certified, AES-256 encryption on everything. Your claimants' records never touch a training pipeline.

sections.heading: Dodonai Tools for Disability Benefits Practices

cards.title: Medical Chronologies for Disability Claims
cards.description: How long does your team spend building a med chron for each claimant? Dodonai generates detailed chronologies documenting conditions, treatments, and functional limitations — tracking every provider's findings on exertional and non-exertional restrictions that support the RFC at Steps 4 and 5. Each entry links back to the original page for verification.

cards.title: Narrative Medical Summaries
cards.description: Provider-by-provider narratives that tell the story from alleged onset date through current treatment. Use them to draft pre-hearing briefs, ALJ memoranda, and reconsideration appeals in the organized format adjudicators expect.

cards.title: Reduce Per-Case Costs
cards.description: Outsourced record review runs $5 to $15 per page. Dodonai delivers organized chronologies and summaries starting at $30 per month — a fraction of what high-volume disability practices currently spend on case prep.

cards.title: Meet Tight Filing Deadlines
cards.description: Sixty days for reconsideration, sixty days to request a hearing, and a date last insured that may be approaching fast. Process medical records in minutes so you submit complete evidence packages on time — initial applications, reconsideration requests, or pre-hearing submissions.

cards.title: HIPAA Compliant Processing
cards.description: Disability files contain sensitive medical and personal data. Every upload gets AES-256 encryption on a SOC 2-certified, HIPAA-compliant platform with signed BAAs.

cards.title: Handle More Claims Without More Staff
cards.description: Your paralegal capacity shouldn't cap your caseload. Dodonai automates the most time-intensive part of case preparation, letting your existing team take on more claims without the bottleneck.

items.title: Upload the Claimant's Medical Records
items.description: Upload medical records from all treating providers. The platform handles PDFs, Word files, text files, and scanned documents with built-in AI OCR. No preprocessing required — upload records exactly as you receive them.

items.title: AI Extracts and Organizes the Medical History
items.description: Dodonai's AI reads through the records, extracts dates, providers, diagnoses, treatments, medications, and functional assessments, then organizes everything into structured chronologies and narrative summaries. Add key topics to focus on specific conditions, functional limitations, or time periods — like isolating records from the alleged onset date forward, or pulling mental health treatment for Paragraph B criteria.

items.title: Review, Download, and Submit
items.description: Review the output in the interactive viewer with side-by-side source linking. Download finished chronologies and summaries as PDF, Word, or Excel files ready for submission to the SSA, insurance carriers, or VA.

faq.question: How does Dodonai help with SSDI medical record review?
faq.answer: Upload the claimant's records and get a chronology that organizes diagnoses, treatments, and provider visits by date — with page citations so your team can quickly pull the functional limitation evidence that drives RFC determinations.

faq.question: Can Dodonai handle records from many different providers?
faq.answer: Yes. Upload records from all providers and Dodonai consolidates them into a unified chronology. Filter by provider, date, or diagnosis to isolate specific treatment periods — like mental health notes for a Paragraph B analysis.

faq.question: Does Dodonai work for long-term disability insurance claims?
faq.answer: Yes. The chronologies and summaries work for any disability claim type — SSDI, employer-sponsored LTD under ERISA, individual disability policies, and VA claims requiring service-connection evidence. Organized documentation helps regardless of whether the reviewer is an ALJ, an insurance carrier, or a VA rater.

faq.question: How much can a disability benefits practice save?
faq.answer: Outsourced vendors charge $5 to $15 per page. Dodonai processes pages for as little as $0.02 each. For practices handling dozens of active claims with records spanning years and multiple providers, the per-case savings add up fast.

faq.question: Is Dodonai secure enough for claimant medical records?
faq.answer: Fully HIPAA compliant — signed BAAs on every account, SOC 2 Type II certification, AES-256 encryption at rest and in transit. Claimant records never touch a training pipeline, and your firm controls data retention.

faq.question: Does Dodonai handle scanned medical records?
faq.answer: Yes. Built-in {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI-powered OCR}} extracts text from scanned PDFs and image-based documents. Upload records directly from provider offices without a separate OCR step.
